tr.td: Sennosides, croscarmellose sodium, dicalcium phosphate, hypromellose, magnesium stearate, microcrystalline cellulose, mineral oil

td.content: Senna should not be used in people with dehydration, diarrhea, or loose stools. It can make these conditions worse.

tr.td: benzyl alcohol, cetyl alcohol, cetyl esters wax, octyldodecanol, polysorbate 60, sorbitan monostearate, stearyl alcohol, water

Insert 1 mg into the vagina 2 (two) times a day. Wash affected area and dry thoroughly. Apply a thin layer over affected area twice daily (morning and night) supervise children in the use of this product use daily for 4 weeks if condition persists longer, ask a doctor this product is not effective on the scalp or nails

td.content: This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems.

tr.td: Powdered cellulose, magnesium stearate, sodium metabisulfite†, pregelatinized starch (corn), and modified starch (corn).
Take 1 tablet by mouth every 4 (four) hours as needed for moderate pain. Acetaminophen and codeine phosphate tablets are indicated for the relief of mild to moderately severe pain.

td.content: Codeine may be habit-forming. Patients should take the drug only for as long as it is prescribed, in the amounts prescribed, and no more frequently than prescribed.

tr.td:
The patient arrived with burns on her pelvis and burns on both upper thighs.
The thigh burns were exacerbated by the wheelchair pad which retained the water and the heat causing the blistering and pain.
Tylenol 3s were administered for pain

The patient was found to have 2nd degree burns on her pelvis and 3rd degree burns on both upper thighs.
The thigh burns were exacerbated by the wheelchair pad which retained the water and the heat causing the blistering and pain.
The burns were cleaned and dressed.
The burn on the right thigh required skin grafting.
Tylenol 3s were administered for pain

text.content: Patient claims someone threw hot coffee on him.

td.content: Achieve timely healing of burned areas
Family will demonstrate understanding of safety measures for wheelchair bound individuals
Ensure patient does not have a re-occurence
Patient will demonstrate ability to transfer from Bed to Wheelchair and from Wheelchair to Toilet
With minimal pain and no effect on burn sites

paragraph.content: Transfer ability, impaired: limitation of independence movement between two nearby surfaces
Mobility: wheelchair, impaired: limitation of independent operation of wheelchair within the environment
Self-care deficit, bathing: impaired to perform or complete bathing/hygiene activities for self

item.paragraph: In case of fever, take Tylenol as needed

item.paragraph: If weeping occurs, visit emergency clinic immediately.
